chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher L McGoldrick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
**CORRECTED 6-7-2016:  Restitution is Joint and Several.**
It is the court's intention that the Department of Corrections can take 25% from all money received for the benefit of the inmate while he is incarcerated to be applied to restitution owing to the victim.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's Are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care as well as psychological evaluation and follow through with treatment recommendations. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. No contact, directly or indirectly, with the victim or co-actors. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law unless sample has been previously provided, however, defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.
